postLogin.personalDataProtection: Right to the protection of personal data

cancel.title: Are you sure you want to cancel the procedure?

field.assistanceChannels: Assistance channels must have unique types
field.max: You can enter a maximum of {{max}} characters
field.privacyCritical: Mandatory field for a sensitive service

searchById.helperText: Enter a 26-character alphanumeric ID code and click on right search icon
searchById.validText: Click on right search icon inside field to perform search
searchById.label: Search by service ID

assistanceChannels.label: Assistance channels
assistanceChannels.notice: It is mandatory to indicate at least one assistance channel

description.helperText: Read how to write service description correctly.
description.label: Description

extraConfig.label: Add configuration
extraConfig.description: These features allow you to enrich the service with many additional parameters. Some of these require the signing of an ad hoc contract.

cta.label: Button with external link
cta.description: Add a button that takes you to a web page with more information about the service.

fims.label: FIMS Protocol
fims.description: Single sign-on link between the service and an institution channel.

name.helperText: Read how to write service name correctly.
name.label: Service name

requireSecureChannel.helperText: Services and messages that include sensitive data must comply with the requirements of paragraph 7.3 of the IO Guidelines. Find more
requireSecureChannel.label: Sensitive service

scope.helperText: You can change the areas of expertise at any time in yours Reserved area.
scope.label: Area of ​​competence

step1.label: Service description
step1.description: If you have difficulty filling out the description, follow the IO services operating manual where you will find recommendations and advice on how to best fill out the service form.

step2.label: Information & contacts
step2.description: To provide the service in IO it is necessary to associate it with a series of information and assistance channels.

step3.label: Extra configuration
step3.description: These features allow you to enrich the service with many additional parameters. Be careful, some of these require the signing of an ad hoc contract.

migration.title: Import services from the Developer Portal

disclaimer.title: The Developer Portal is being decommissioned
disclaimer.description: At the moment you can use both portals, but soon IO services will only be able to be managed from the Reserved Area. You don't have to import all the services at the same time: it is possible to do multiple imports.

status.title: Import status
status.description: Below is the list of delegates with the import status and the last update date.
status.success: The services, or a part of them, have been imported and you can find them in the Services section.

modal.title: Select the delegates who created the services
modal.description: The imported services will only be visible in the Reserved Area and will be accessible to all users of the organisation.

modal.title: Rotate API Key
modal.description: By rotating this API Key, you deactivate the existing one and generate a new one, with the same attributes.

overview.title: Overview
overview.description: Monitor all your activities from here.

services.title: Services
services.description: View and manage your institution's services.
services.empty: There are no services for this institution yet.

keys.title: API Key
keys.description: Use this key for programmatic USE operations of the service.

new-service.title: Create a new service
new-service.description: Follow the steps and fill in the required fields. Once created, you can send the service for review and then proceed to publish it on the IO app.

edit-service.title: Edit the service
edit-service.description: Follow the steps and fill in the required fields. Once modified, you can send the service for review and then proceed to publish it on the IO app.

keys.title: API Keys
keys.description: Here you can manage the API keys to be used to authenticate the institution's requests.

manage.title: API Key Manage
manage.description: Use this key for programmatic operations of creating a new service or updating an existing one.

lifecycle.message: This service is a {{status}} version of an already active IO service.

publication.message: This active service has a {{status}} version.

rejected.message: This service requires modifications before it can be published in the IO app.

reason.label: Read the reasons for refusal here.
reason.title: Reasons for refusal

alerts.submitted: This service is under review. While waiting for the response from our PagoPA team, the service cannot be modified.

modal.title: Do you want to delete this service permanently?
modal.description: By deleting this service, it will no longer be visible in the IO app and will no longer be usable in this reserved area. This action is irreversible.

logo.disclaimerText:
Insert only your institution logo.
You will be responsible for inserting images other than the one indicated.

modal.title: Do you want to publish this service in the IO app?
modal.description: Citizens will see it in the “Services” section of the app, under the name of your institution. You can hide it at any time.

modal.title: Do you want to send this service for review?
modal.description:
The service will be reviewed by the IO team. Monitor the outcome of the review in Services:
  • if the service is approved, it will be automatically published;
  • in the event that the service is rejected, you will be able to consult the reason and make the necessary changes to be able to send it again for review.

modal.title: Do you want to hide this service from the IO app?
modal.description: Citizens will no longer see it in the “Services” section of the app, under the name of your institution. You can publish it again at any time.

preview.title: Preview
preview.info: This is how the service description will be displayed in the IO app.

switcher.title: Which version of the service do you want to view?
switcher.description: The {{name}} service has two versions. Select the one you want to view.
